summary: A realistic ENB config, perfect for those who want to change the look of the game but not too drastically.
descriptionHtml:
[center]
Proper front page coming soon.

[size=5]Ideal brightness settings should be in the center of the meter.[/size]
 If you\'re still encountering brightness issues use the \"Disable Ambient Occlusion\" version of the config in \'/Extra Files/\'

[size=3][color=#BF0000][b]I DO NOT CLAIM ANY OWNERSHIP FOR THESE FILES.[/b][/color]
[color=#FF8000]The credit should go to Boris Vorontsov, but for the sake of recognition, feel free to call this \'Yadda\'s ENB config\' if you feel the need to mention it. If you want to change some values and release this as your own, go for it.[/color][/size][/center]

	[color=#00BF00][size=3][b]FEATURES[/b][/size][/color][color=#FF8000]
[b]----------------------------------------------------------------[/b][/color]
- A more vibrant look for Skyrim, without sacrificing any important tonal values or colors.
- Darker caves and Dungeons with more emphasis on light sources; put your Magelight and Torches to use, you\'ll need them.
- Beautiful lighting, without much bloom or eye-rape ( a la Battlefield 3).
- Better HDR adaptation, never trip out on Candlelight spells again!
- Realistic specular lighting.


	[color=#00BF00][size=3][b]INSTRUCTIONS[/b][/size][/color][color=#FF8000]
[b]----------------------------------------------------------------[/b][/color]
This .RAR uses \'ENBSeries 0.105 BETA\' for TES Skyrim. If a newer one comes out please update accordingly

- Place the files from \'Base Files\' in [b]\'c:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\'[/b]

- If you also want to use my preferences feel free to put the .ini files from the \'prefs\' folder in 
  [b]\'c:\\Users\\_YOURNAME_\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\'[/b]

- Run \'SkyrimLauncer.exe\" once.

- Check out \'Extra Files\' for other options.

- Go to your [b]\'skyrimprefs.ini\'[/b] in [b]\'c:\\Users\\_YOURNAME_\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\'[/b]
[color=#FFBF40]
- Use \'bFloatPointRenderTarget=1\' 	(Also required for SSAO)
- Insert \'sD3DDevice=\"ENB\"\'		(If it isn\'t there already)
[/color]
I tested this config on a single GTX 560 TI and it works great. If you have anything similar or 
better you should have no problems using this config.


	[color=#00BF00][size=3][b]RECOMMENDED MODS[/b][/size][/color][color=#FF8000]
[b]----------------------------------------------------------------[/b][/color]
The following mods look really good with this config (I used them while taking the screenshots):
[color=#FFBF40]
- Vurt\'s Flora Overhaul 			( [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=141]CLICK[/url] )
- Realistic Water Textures 1.5b by isoku 	( [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=711]CLICK[/url] )
- Enhanced Night Skyrim by CptJoker 		( [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=85]CLICK[/url] )
- Every mod from Xenius				( [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/modules/members/index.php?id=726673]CLICK[/url] )
- Lush grass by OpticShooter			( [url=http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3288]CLICK[/url] )	
- Lush trees by OpticShooter			( [url=http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=3385]CLICK[/url] )

[/color]
These are 100% optional, obviously.

[color=#BF0000][b]!!! I am not to be held responsible in the odd chance that computer bursts into flames and neither is Boris Vorontsov. !!![/b][/color]
author: Yadda

files.name: Yaddas ENB Config 1_01
files.changelogHtml:
Added optional configs for no SSAO, and optimal image quality
Implimented FXAA Injector settings to lower blue values
Improved performance with base Ambient Occlusion settings, no visible change in image quality

files.name: Yaddas ENB Config 1_021
files.changelogHtml: Updated to ENB v0.102 Tatsudoshi, slight changes for better optimization and compatibility (hopefully)
